docs.snippet: The International Olympic Committee has approved a resolution that assures China's return to Olympic competition for the first time in 32 years, but leaves Nationalist China's status in doubt.
docs.lead_paragraph: The International Olympic Committee has approved a resolution that assures China's return to Olympic competition for the first time in 32 years, but leaves Nationalist China's status in doubt.
docs.abstract: International Olympic Committee approves resolution that will allow China and Taiwan to compete in Games; while athletes from China will be allowed to compete under their flag and national anthem, resolution directs Taiwan to change its Olympic name from Republic of China, flag and anthem to remain eligible for games; Taiwan officials say they will boycott Summer Games and appeal decision (M)

headline.main: A 2-China Plan for the Olympics; Olympic Group Votes 2-China Plan for 1980 'Bottom of the Barrel' 'A Political Decision'

docs.snippet: I have not yet visited all the people and institutions that fought for my freedom for two and one-half years. If I have not done so in spite of the fact that I left Argentina toward the end of September, it is because I was left bewildered by my...
docs.lead_paragraph: I have not yet visited all the people and institutions that fought for my freedom for two and one-half years. If I have not done so in spite of the fact that I left Argentina toward the end of September, it is because I was left bewildered by my first encounters in Tel Aviv, New York and Washington.
docs.abstract: Article by Jacobo Timerman, Argentine newspaper La Opinion publisher who was freed in Oct after 29 months of detention (M)

headline.main: Girding To Fight For Rights Globally

docs.snippet: CARACAS, Venezuela--Celestino Rojas left the harsh climate and perpetual poverty of the Colombian Hanos three years ago looking for El Dorado. Like millions of his countrymen, he hoped to find a job in Venezuela's booming oil economy. "Since I've...
docs.lead_paragraph: CARACAS, Venezuela--Celestino Rojas left the harsh climate and perpetual poverty of the Colombian Hanos three years ago looking for El Dorado. Like millions of his countrymen, he hoped to find a job in Venezuela's booming oil economy. "Since I've been here," he said, "I've been arrested seven times, deported three times and cheated out of almost a year's pay. The authorities treat me like dirt. But at least I can work."
docs.abstract: Article on illegal migration each year of millions of Colombians to Venezuela; holds Colombians engaged in one of largest migratory movements in hemisphere are supplying Venezuela with needed farm and factory hands, but they are also alienating politicians and union leaders by undercutting Venezuelan wages; attempts by Venezuelan Government to resolve issue discussed; map; chart shows Colombia's growth in population and birth rate, '55-estimated '85 (L)

headline.main: For Millions In Colombia, Venezuela Is Eldorado

docs.snippet: LA PAZ, Bolivia, Dec. 22 Trucks laden with food are once again groaning up the steep cobblestoned streets that were recently emptied by a military coup and a subsquent general strike.
docs.lead_paragraph: LA PAZ, Bolivia, Dec. 22 Trucks laden with food are once again groaning up the steep cobblestoned streets that were recently emptied by a military coup and a subsquent general strike.
docs.abstract: Bolivia has resumed look of normality under Pres Lydia Gueiler Tejada, but there are still daily rumors of imminent takeover; portrait of Gueiler Tejada (M)

headline.main: Bolivia Appears Normal Again but Threats of a Takeover Linger; Necessary but Unpopular Moves
